title: 3 Rare Diseases You Might Not Have Heard Of

scenes.title: Scene 1: Familial Hypercholesterolemia
scenes.narration: Our first rare disease is Familial Hypercholesterolemia, or FH.  This genetic disorder leads to extremely high cholesterol levels, even in childhood, significantly increasing the risk of heart attacks and strokes. Early diagnosis and treatment are crucial for managing FH and preventing complications.
scenes.image_prompt: young person with family receiving medical consultation about genetic disorder

scenes.title: Scene 2:  Progeria
scenes.narration: Next, we have Progeria, a rare genetic condition that causes children to age rapidly.  Sadly, there's no cure for Progeria, and most children with this condition don't live past their teenage years. Ongoing research offers hope for treatments to improve the length and quality of life for these children.
scenes.image_prompt: doctor interacting with child with progeria

scenes.title: Scene 3: Epidermolysis Bullosa
scenes.narration: Finally, let's talk about Epidermolysis Bullosa, or EB.  People with EB have extremely fragile skin that blisters and tears easily, even from minor friction. Managing EB involves meticulous wound care and pain management.  Researchers are exploring new therapies like gene therapy to alleviate symptoms and improve the lives of individuals with EB.
scenes.image_prompt: close-up of hands with epidermolysis bullosa receiving gentle bandaging
